What is the value of 0! (zero factorial)?

Factorial means multiplying a number by all positive integers less than it. For example, 3! = 3 × 2 × 1 = 6. By definition, the factorial of 0 is always 1 because there is only one way to arrange zero objects (do nothing).
The HCF (Highest Common Factor) is the largest number that divides both 36 and 48 without a remainder. For these numbers, it is 12.
The LCM (Lowest Common Multiple) is the smallest number that both 12 and 15 can divide into. For these numbers, it is 60.
What is the square root of 144?
The square root of a number is the value that, when multiplied by itself, gives the original number. For 144, the square root is 12 because 12 × 12 = 144.

The formula for the area of a circle is πr². Using π = 22/7 and r = 7, the area is 22/7 × 7 × 7 = 154 cm².
